section.name: Official log4j documentation
section.p: With the exception of the complete manual, the following documentation is included with the standard log4j distribution and also browsable online:

p.li: short log4j manual,
complete log4j manual (commercial),
javadoc documentation,
Chainsaw documentation,
project history,
FAQ,
troubleshooting guide.

ul.li: Spanish translation of the short manual Mauricio Santacruz (PDF, HTML)
German translation of the short manual, courtesy of Dirk Schnelle. (PDF only at this time)
Simplified Chinese and traditional Chinese translation of the short manual (HTML only) by Jaxwiki.org.

p.li: Don't Use System.out.println! Use Log4j by Vipan Singla
Build Flexible Logs With log4j by Vikram Goyal
log4j by Ashley J.S Mills, University Of Birmingham
Add logging to your Java Applications by Kevin Brown
How does the Java logging API stack up against log4j? by Kevin Brown
Think Again by Ceki Gülcü
Supporting the log4j RepositorySelector by Ceki Gülcü
Log4j class diagrams, courtesy of David Tonhofer
Understanding Classloaders: log4j in a J2EE Environment by Vikram Goyal
Logging für Java-Programme, Zu den Akten by Bernhard Bablok in Linux Magazine, 04/2002.
Instant logging: Harness the power of log4j with Jabber by Ruth Zamorano and Rafael Luque, in developerWorks 2003
Using Log4j in the Sun Java System Application Server by Matthew Litkey, Jay Galvin, and Marina Sum, from Sun.
Reporting Application Errors by Email by Sean C. Sullivan, 2004-09-24, published by O'Reilly.
Log4J In 30 Minutes Or Less by John Munsch
Log4j, a logging package for the Java language by Ceki Gülcü
Log4j by Brent Twenter

section.name: Training & Professional support
section.p: The following organisations offer log4j-related consultancy and training services. Their inclusion on this page does not imply endorsement by the Apache Software Foundation.

ul.li: QOS.ch, Switzerland proposes professional support contracts.
The Good Software Company proposes log4j training courses.

p.b: If you would like your log4j-related article or service to be listed here, then please send a note to the log4j-user@logging.apache.org list.
